attributes.action: Enforce a limit on the cost of vehicle insurance for young and new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance in the UK has been continuously on the rise for several years. The cost of insurance for young drivers aged 17 years old even on low powered, low insurance grouped vehicles can run them up to the likes of £1500-£3000 with no cap. The average cost a new young driver will pay is around £2000
attributes.additional_details:
This has been a well known fact for many years that insurance companies have been picking out every penny they can from young and new drivers with no justification. The cost of insurance supercedes the price of many young drivers value of the car sometimes up to 5 times.
This is hindering young drivers from wanting to drive and becoming independent as the cost is becoming extortionate and is only rising every year. There needs to be a cap on the amount insurance companies can charge.

attributes.action: Make Football compulsory for all schools across the UK (Public and State)
attributes.background: Football is the biggest sport in the world with over 1/3rd of England watching the World Cup games that England were involved in. Some children do not get the chance to play football and excel at the sport, public and state schools.
attributes.additional_details: Every pupil deserves the chance to be involved in a team sport, where it is not physical like rugby, which some students do not want to partake in due to fear of injury.

attributes.action: I believe that it should be mandatory for ALL lunch breaks to be paid.
attributes.background: As of right now, when working on the minimum wage, the employee will lose either £36.90 or £39.15 each week, depending on age group. This is roughly £147.60 or £156.60 lost each month. In my opinion, this is outrageous; ultimately feeling like being punished for needing to eat and rest.

attributes.action: Tax financial institutions to pay for social care, instead of personal taxation.
attributes.background:
Banks caused the global financial meltdown and took billions in bailouts from taxpayers. I think they’d should pay this back via a social care levy.
It would also help to restore public confidence in the banks.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to allow Northern England to claim independence.
attributes.background: Northern England is always the most underfunded out of everywhere in the UK. We in northern England pay taxes, yet it is always the south that spends it. We have the worst public transport system in the UK, and many other services including the NHS receive the smallest amount of funding in England.
attributes.additional_details:
Northern England should be allowed to hold a referendum on whether we should claim independence from England and form our own country within the UK.

Northern England is always forgotten about in the south including Downing Street. The government does not fund or maintain northern England properly as it should. 

We in northern England pay taxes, yet the south spends it. It is time to hold a referendum in Northern England !

attributes.action: Cap Tax Avoidance - Introduce 1% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: It is not unreasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated fairly and equally under the tax legislation.  The minimum corporation tax rate based on turnover should be the mechanism to ensure that this happens.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum corporation tax can be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.   The new tax could easily be extended in the future to include all cypto-currency transactions to ensure the tax compliance.

On average, the FTSE 100 companies’ corporation tax expense to turnover has gone from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years and companies like eBay pay even less with 0.2% of their turnover going to the UK Tax-man!

attributes.action: Public transport(bus) to have cabin filters to protect passengers and drivers
attributes.background: high pollution is danger for all of us, the cabin filter will protect and save lives
attributes.additional_details: it was a few documentary on tv shown that danger (heavy) car emission are cumulated in public transport like tram and buses. The ventilate is not an option, a proper pollen filter will make a different and it will save some lives, and help

attributes.action: Increase research and funding into Lyme Diease and co-infections
attributes.background: Lyme Diease and co-infections is a serious infection that isn't being treated correctly by the NICE guidelines please sign this to force the research and funding into this infection and strength the NHS to treat this debilitating Diease
attributes.additional_details: Lyme is becoming more and more reported in the UK and all over the world, case numbers are getting higher. After i become infected i found the treatement given in the UK was not enough and i keep relapsing, because of this ive been forced to go private to get the right treatment we need a cure not symtom management !!

attributes.action: Fine people who call 999 or show up to A&E without life threatening problems.
attributes.background: One in three calls are emergency and life threatening injuries. Two out of three are not. We can prevent wasting £8.50 on those who call 999 or show up to A&E wasting the healthcare’s time when they have other services they can utilise. Fining a person can help to deter these time wasting problems.
attributes.additional_details: 1. https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/society/2015/dec/25/frequent-999-callers-nhs-england-ambulance-emergency

attributes.action: Include the welsh flag on the union jack
attributes.background: We must include wales in our community. they are a valuable member of the UK and they seem to be forgotten. i am not a welsh person myself but i think we can all agree they have a fine accent, also the best flag in the world. so why doesn't the UK include it. This HAS to change!
attributes.additional_details: It would be greatly appreciated if the UK government took this into consideration. i think we can all agree this would be a great thing

attributes.action: Make compassionate leave a Statutory Right With Reasonable Period off & full pay
attributes.background: compassionate leave is not offered in my contract, I researched this online and found that this is not a statutory right. If like me you work on commission and earn a low salary you will struggle financially in an emergency, I think this needs to change and people should have the right to grieve.
attributes.additional_details:
My wife's grandmother died and we had to fly to get to the funeral, upon my return I was told that I would need to use my 5 of my holiday days (I only get 20) as they didn't offer compassionate leave. I thought this was unfair and I feel that this needs to change and should be a basic right. 

gov.uk website 
"pay, your employer may pay you for time off to look after dependents but they don't have to. check your contact, company handbook or internet site to see if there are rules about this. "

attributes.action: Renationalise all rail as they do not care for the consumer at all.
attributes.background: The new timetable that has been released has been a complete mess as their have been hunders of cancellations in peak times. They have removed services to blatantly avoid paying delay repay. Its abhorrent they get away with this and its about time the rail companies became publically owned.
attributes.additional_details: Check any timetable and you'll see the amount of services cancelled daily.

attributes.action: Include awareness of emotional and physical abuse to the national curriculum
attributes.background: We're at a time in our lives and our society where abuse, emotional or physical, is being seen as normal. Children as young as even 10 or some younger are not able to recognise normal behaviour anymore and see abuse of any kind as normal. This needs to stop now, any age it's not acceptable.

attributes.action: Do not ban 'cartoon characters' from 'unhealthy foods'.
attributes.background: MPs on the Health Committee wish to ban cartoon characters on 'unhealthy food' (such as Tony the Tiger & Nestle's Milky Bar Kid). These brand mascots have been around for decades yet obesity rates are only very high now due to bad parenting.
attributes.additional_details: Link to BBC Article - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44298135

attributes.action: To implement a notice period before stopping disability benefits after reviewing
attributes.background: At present many genuine disability claimants are losing benefits without any prior warning after going through a biased assessment process. Thus placing them instantly into financial difficulties and a world of uncertainty & worry even rendering many unable to actually pay the bills etc.
attributes.additional_details: Being thrust into a world of woe. Going through the stresses of being suddenly financially restricted then chasing the gov for reconsideration and then forcing an appeal process which many win this process surely costs the gov even more going through the whole tribunal process takes months to  year. Yes the money gets backdated. But all that addition stress and worry is totally Unnecessary. In human rights terms it's totally disgusting that our DWP treats the disabled this way.

attributes.action: Allegations of workplace bullying against John Bercow should be investigated.
attributes.background: John Bercow, the Speaker of the House of Commons, has been accused of workplace bullying. MPs have rejected the proposal of an investigation into these claims.  The accusations against the Speaker need to be investigated. Those elected to the House of Commons must be accountable for their behaviour.

attributes.action: Urge the Commonwealth to suspend Pakistan’s membership.
attributes.background: The former Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif, has not been given a fair trial by the Supreme Court of Pakistan. His life and political career may be in danger.
attributes.additional_details:
The Supreme Court of Pakistan has taken away the right from Nawaz Sharif to contest the next general elections in Pakistan. He has also been disqualified from Prime Ministership. Nawaz Sharif is a target of the Pakistan Army and Supreme Court of Pakistan. 
 
The UK Government should urge the Commonwealth Ministerial Action Group to suspend Pakistan’s Commonwealth membership, until they give fair trial and right to contest election to Nawaz Sharif.

attributes.action: A fresh look at Hi-tech solutions to reduce traffic congestion nationwide.
attributes.background:
Using roads sensibly will save most people money and will help save lives; according to the BBC article 1 in 6 deaths worldwide are due to pollution. 
We want the government to look at solutions available today that can dramatically reduce congestion, such as a smart phone app for car sharing.
attributes.additional_details:
Using a Car share app on a phone provides high levels of safety and an alternate lift home if necessary. 

The government is obliged to improve air quality.  http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38990192
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-41678533

Using DfT report from 2005, an example an average car travelling 20 miles each day with 3 occupants, will save £1,000 per occupant per year.  
http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http:/www.dft.gov.uk/pgr/sustainable/cars/makingcarsharingmarch2005.pdf

attributes.action: Decriminalise drug possession
attributes.background: People are currently being needlessly prosecuted for consuming drugs. This method has proved innefective in curbing drug use and deaths. By decriminalising drug possession we can save millions of pounds on convictions and invest in harm reduction methods and education as shown effective by Portugal.
attributes.additional_details: As shown by this link https://www.statista.com/chart/10320/drug-deaths-in-europe/ Portugal's system of decriminalisation has resulted in the lowest death rate from drugs if any country in Europe. By decriminalising drug possession users and addicts alike can get help to stop their addiction and use drugs in a safer manner. Moreover, the majority of drug users do not pose a threat to society and their lives are being ruined due to unjust drug laws. We help the disabled, why not drug users?

attributes.action: Provide mental health training to all teachers
attributes.background: Specialised mental health training for teachers will help them to identify children with mental health issues and get them the help they need. I want an end to the stigma.

attributes.action: Stop stretched NHS staff being criminalised and struck off for honest mistakes.
attributes.background: We ask government to adopt a ‘just’ approach in healthcare investigation to ensure staff aren’t scapegoated for systemic errors. 1) Change the Law so staff errors are only prosecuted if intentional or grossly careless 2) Change the Medical Act so regulators are limited to retraining, not punishment.
attributes.additional_details:
NHS working conditions are incredibly stretched. Despite understaffing and underfunding, staff face criminal charges and losing their licence to work forever if they make an honest mistake. This is unfair, unconstructive and worsens patient safety. 

We ask government to adopt a ‘just’/‘no blame’ approach to healthcare investigation (like the aviation industry) to save taxpayers money, improve NHS working conditions and staff retainment, and streamline error investigation to make patients safer.

This petition has been co-authored by Dr Hugo Farne and Dr Jenny Vaughan

attributes.action: Protect house purchasers/vendors with a defined process/law & financial penalty
attributes.background:
A few years ago I ‘sold’ my property 4 times but only the 5th sale completed.

A property purchase/sale is the single biggest transaction but  there is no law to protect buyer or seller, the industry relies on morales.
attributes.additional_details:
Purchasers need to be given a cooling off period and then after this there should be defined criteria or extenuating circumstances for pulling out. 

Vendors should not be allowed to pull out of a sale except for extenuating circumstances. 

There should be a financial commitment prior to exchange which reimburses loses.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to use lies as part of a campaign for a public vote
attributes.background: The use of lies in public campaigns is  growing

attributes.action: Force all local councils to offer a dedicated plastic waste bin
attributes.background: In the wake of the current plastic crisis I find it staggering that there are still councils like mine in Swindon that do not provide people with a dedicated plastic waste bin.
attributes.additional_details: For example in Swindon if we wish to recycle plastic we have to buy white bin bags and then the waste will be collected. No it doesn't cost much but it is obviously enough to put people off and that is evident every bin collection day. So while the government think about what the consumer can do to help the issue with plastic bottle return points, I think they need to also look at what they should be doing and this is a simple step already offered by other councils.

attributes.action: Require all toll bridges to treat disabled people equally
attributes.background: The Government must require parity for all disabled people to use toll bridges and roads for free, not just those on Disability Living Allowance. For example, I’m disabled but too old to qualify for disability living allowance which means I can’t use the Dartford river crossing for free.
attributes.additional_details: As a blue badge holder I can go through London without paying the congestion charge surely it should be the same using the Dartford river crossing. This is free for people who receive Disability Living Allowance and has an exemption from paying vehicle tax as a result. However anyone in my position is still required to pay due to being too old to apply for Disability Living Allowance.

attributes.action: No military action in Syria until perpetrators of chemical attacks are verified.
attributes.background: Involvement in missile strikes or other military action against the Syrian government will escalate the conflict, resulting in yet greater loss of life. Please hold back until we know more.

attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and “Legalese” is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of peanut products in cinemas
attributes.background: Going to the cinema can be a traumatic time for many people with a peanut/nut allergy. Spending most of the time looking around to make sure that someone next to you is not about to open a packet of Peanut M&M’s or another product containing peanuts. Families should feel safe in a place of enjoyment
attributes.additional_details:
Peanut allergies affect 1 in 55 children in the UK, why put our children at risk in a place that is suppose to be enjoyable? 
 Every cinema I have visited in the UK so far sells Peanut M&M’s as a film-time snack. Are there not enough other snacks available without the need to sell peanut based products?? 
 Nuts are in the top 3 most common food allergies in the UK to date, and with this allergy being also airborne this causes more of a danger in close public spaces such as cinemas.

attributes.action: Scrap the make taxation digital regulations for all business below £100k profit
attributes.background: The make tax digital regulations deliver no benefits to either HMRC or small business, especially those on cash accounting or low profit business. The additional burden will inevitably close or damage many business', &  the economy so the best solution would be to scrap it before it is too late
attributes.additional_details: The making tax digital regulations are fundamentally flawed and failed to take note of the consultation warnings of the impact they would have on in particular small business's, so instead of running a parallel trial where the uptake would be voluntary they have instead opted for closure of business and damage to the economy. Therefore the only safe solution is to scrap these for low profit business and make it voluntary instead so that those who see benefits can & others continue to file online

attributes.action: Require all schools to allow boys to wear shorts.
attributes.background: Most schools no longer give boys the option to wear shorts except when taking part in physical education however all schools allow girls to wear skirts. This is sexist and should be resolved by requiring schools to allow boys to wear shorts.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for motorbikes to have different coloured headlamps to cars
attributes.background: Driving at night, in heavy traffic or in wet weather it is often difficult to differentiate a motorbike weaving down between lanes from other cars.  If motorbikes had a different coloured headlamp (yellow maybe), drivers, incl. other riders, looking in rear/side view mirrors would better spot them.
attributes.additional_details: I think this would significantly improve road safety by reducing the number of car accidents with motorbikes when they are not seen by drivers joining / changing lanes in heavy traffic.  The headlight colour would obviously need to be one that would afford the bike rider equal visibility.

attributes.action: Make financial management a compulsory part of education in schools
attributes.background:
The national level of personal debt in this country is on the rise. It will only get worse unless something is done now.

Proper financial management has to be taught in schools from a young age to prepare children for the future.

This could be included in maths or done as a separate subject.
attributes.additional_details:
I work in local government, dealing with insolvency and large debts on a daily basis. I've seen so many cases where people clearly don't know how to manage their finances and need solid advice on how to budget.

National statistics for Individual Voluntary Arrangements (IVAs) show that they are steadily on the rise since their introduction. However, I've seen several terminted because people can't make enough sacrifices and stick to arrangements. This then leads to harsher financial penalties.

attributes.action: Introduce new regulations for the development of Artificial Intelligence.
attributes.background: Artificial Intelligence is intelligent behaviour, exhibited by computers. Currently AI is at a primitive stage, home assistants are starting to play a role in our lives, but what they can do for us is limited. I want to see new regulations, for further development of AI and Machine Learning.
attributes.additional_details:
Many experts, including founder of Microsoft, Bill Gates, and Professor Stephen Hawking, have raised concerns over the development of AI. Many in particular believe that, by 2045, the point of Technological Singularity will occur. This means that, if AI is developed, without regulation, it could surpass human intelligence.

AI is useful at the present time, however, continuing to develop this, without limits, is dangerous. Machines will always make mistakes, let's not become inferior to them.

attributes.action: Reduce tax on smoking tobbaco
attributes.background: Make it cheaper. It’s a choice people have.

attributes.action: Make political education compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: In our politics class we have been debating the crisis of participation and the democratic deficit. We feel that a lack of political participation is caused partly by a lack of political education - so people don't understand how important it is to make their voice heard through voting.

attributes.action: Change English law such that an offer on a house is a binding contract
attributes.background: Making it a more binding contract to offer on a house would help speed up moving house and prevent people spending thousands of pounds only for their buyer to withdraw or the seller to accept to a higher bid. This is how the system works in Scotland.
attributes.additional_details: Twice this year I have accepted offers on my property and spent money in solicitors fees only for them to pull out. I think once an offer is made on a property it should be made harder in law for a person to pull out of buying that property.

attributes.action: Abortion time to be lowered from 24 to 16 weeks.
attributes.background: Survival rates of premature babies have improved since 1990, when the law was last changed. Medical science and tech have made it easier for premature babies to survive at earlier dates. It's inhumane that this law hasn't been revised in nearly 20 years.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1976846/Why-this-abortion-doctor-wants-to-see-time-limits-reduced-to-16-weeks.html

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty to reduce crime rates in the UK
attributes.background: We believe that bringing back the death penalty will help to reduce crimes being committed and to create a safer community for us and future generations. Also it will help to get murderers and rapists off the streets to make us less worried when going out or letting our children out.
attributes.additional_details: We have previously created a questionnaire to gather peoples views and opinions on whether we should bring back the death penalty or not. We asked 22 local residents a range of different questions when we got the questionnaires back out of the 22 people asked 55% feel as though it should be brought back too create a safer environment for our future generations where as the other 45% feel as though it shouldn't be brought back because it is not right to commit the "an eye for and eye" because it is too harsh of a punishment and what if they were framed then they loose their life for nothing.

attributes.action: Make GBL a higher class than cannabis, currently only a class C
attributes.background: A lot of people have died from the date rape drug GBL yet it’s only a class C and available to buy got cleaning purposes off the internet.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me get backing for this share it as much as you like. I’ve lost too many people to the drug and don’t see how it’s a lower class than cannabis.

attributes.action: Make Senior and 16-25 Railcards follow the same Time & Fare restrictions
attributes.background: The 16-25 Railcard is the same cost and appears to be the same as the Senior Railcard (for over 60's). However, the 16-25 card has a list of restrictions that do not apply to the senior card, including a minimum fare and time restrictions. Why are there not the same allowances?
attributes.additional_details: Apprentices, students & the young in work for the most, have to be up early for Uni/Work etc. and are notoriously hard up, at the start of there careers/working bottom end jobs. However while commuting to work as an apprentice, seeing a senior citizen go from there new range rover to the train, then be receiving a vastly discounted fare for the same journey does not seem fair. There are 2 sides as there are less well off elderly, and youth with money, however why give to one and not the other?

attributes.action: Teach schools about emotional & physical wellbeing, mental health & illnesses
attributes.background: I think it is very important that from a young age our children should be taught more about the effects of mental illness and show them a positive outlook on life through physical and emotional wellbeing. This can be yoga, meditation, holistic studies etc. Our children are our future!
attributes.additional_details: As a sufferer of mental illness from a very early age due to family problems & bullying, I think its vital that children should have the opportunity to be more educated on the affects of mental illness as it has such an impact on them in the future. Introducing wellbeing & complementary therapy classes to the curriculum I believe would help a lot of children understand how mental illness works and how to tackle it positively. I strongly believe that emotional and physical wellbeing is crucial.

attributes.action: Ban food waste food away require companies to give it to people who need it
attributes.background: Many companies around the UK throw away waste food at the end of the day away. This needs to stop and the food should be given to people who need it the most, for example homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 France banned food waste and made it compulsory for supermarkets to donate unsold food to charities. The UK government should enact a similar law.

attributes.action: Protection for WW2 RN wrecks that are being blown up & the sailors desecrated
attributes.background:
Royal navy wrecks from ww2 are at risk of being blown up for scrap metal in south East Asia.
Dutch wrecks have simply disappeared.
Our dead saliors have a claim on us to protect them in death as they protected us in life.

No WW2 Royal Navy battleships are preserved. We risk losing them forever
attributes.additional_details:
Everything I have said in the background information is able to be checked in Google and I have come across information in the media, see link below
https://www.theguardian.com/world/ng-interactive/2017/nov/03/worlds-biggest-grave-robbery-asias-disappearing-ww2-shipwrecks

attributes.action: Suspend foreign aid until the national debt has been payed off.
attributes.background: We have a national debt to service, if we give 14.5 billion by 2021 in foreign aid we are borrowing money to give away whilst we lack funds for domestic programs

attributes.action: Stop the 3.2% increase on rail fares set for 2019 after a disastrous 2018
attributes.background: The UK has some of the most expensive rail ticket prices in Europe. The catastrophic implementation of the 2020 plan show all train companies don't have a customer-centric approach and neglect users. Before raising prices, the government should put in place effective quality control system.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of gambling advertisements like the banning of tobacco commercials
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to support people that are suffering from the severity of gambling addiction. Through numerous means, gambling organisations are targeting and taking advantage of  vulnerable gambling addicts by bombarding them with the temptation to give in to their impulses.
attributes.additional_details:
For the serious addict- a slogan that says 'When the Fun Stops, Stop' on the bottom of gambling adverts is not enough to rid any real impulse. The addict that is actively working on their recovery can find a single advert on the internet or TV extremely triggering.

The government has a responsibility to protect it's citizens in the face of corporations that are tactically taking advantage of addicts, particularly where gambling is readily available with a few taps on our mobile devices.

attributes.action: Sexual Assault law must not focus on perpetrator perception
attributes.background: In court a perpetrator may say "it was my perception she consented" and he/she will face no consequence for his actions. Informed consent should be written in law. Consent must be verbalised every time, and can be withdrawn at any time, with no punitive consequence.
attributes.additional_details: The law must say consent cannot be given by anyone asleep, under the influence of drugs or alcohol being unable to express a view, or those without physical capacity to object whether through temporary or permanent disability or because unconscious. Rape is a violent crime designed to humiliate and break people.

attributes.action: Financial incentives for households without a vehicle.
attributes.background: Financial incentives on vehicle free households will reduce air pollution and congestion. It will also reduce poverty, as it will benefit a higher proportion of people on lower incomes initially.

attributes.action: Give the Firemen, the Police, The Emergency Services a National Day.
attributes.background: Recently, I celebrated my daughter's 4 year old birthday. I invited the local Fire crew, then local Police. I was absolutely overwhelmed with their kindness in turning up and taking the time in talking to the little ones, their patience, their absolute dedication to their job.
attributes.additional_details: They all have been through so much lately, and I got to realise, why do we celebrate the army, who rightly protect us (My little girl's father is ex military, bomb disposal), but not these people, who risk their life for us on a daily basis. They deserve our support. So very much. Please do help me giving them the chance to parade, be proud, be cheered, be supported.

attributes.action: Make it legal in England to marry in a forest as it legal in Scotland
attributes.background: My son and his fiancee would like as would possibly many others to marry in a forest. Please help to try and make this happen
